oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-05-18 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 18, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Faron Young (host/performer), guest performers Rusty & Doug (Kershaw), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Shorty Lavender, the Jordanaires, Millie Kirkham, Stringbean, Minnie Pearl (her first appearance after appearing on 'This Is Your Life'), and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 919th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Rusty & Doug; Del Wood; Faron Young; Jordanaires; Millie Kirkham
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Faron Young introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Rod Brasfield) -- Prince Albert commercial (Minnie Pearl, Faron Young) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Faron Young introduces Rusty & Doug -- Going Down The Road (Rusty & Doug) -- Faron Young introduces Del Wood -- [Unidentified piano instrumental] (Del Wood) -- Faron Young talks -- The Shrine Of St. Cecilia (Faron Young, Jordanaires, Millie Kirkham) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Faron Young) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Wood, Del; Minnie Pearl; Jordanaires (Musical group); Kirkham, Millie; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Lavender, Shorty; Young, Faron; Kershaw, Rusty; Kershaw, Doug; Rusty & Doug
